page.title: 01ANCIENT WOODS - MODERN FARM
page.content: This is an area which remains unchanged from ancient times. The deciduous woods of Ebernoe Common are the dominant feature of the landscape. Small farms define the essentially rural economy, agriculture being the mainstay of the community. Arable fields have gradually encroached on the woodland, in some places, leaving only copses, in others, rough pasture for grazing cattle or sheep. Mellowed stone farm buildings show that development has been slow, their present occupants are no longer primarily involved in farming pursuits. Amenities are few, just sufficient to meet the needs of the small population. The now becalmed Furnace Pond tells of an earlier industrial age, but today mechanisation is limited to light industry, the tractor and combine
